719724f-a.title: Manhattan: Fairview Avenue - St. Nicholas Avenue
719724f-a.text:
South on Fairview Avenue from south of St. Nicholas Avenue.
October 26, 1927.
P.L. Sperr,Photographer.

719724f-a.folder: Fairview Avenue & St. Nicholas Avenue, Manhattan, NY

730438f-a.title: General view - [Manhattan - St. Nicholas Avenue - Fairview Avenue - Dyckman Street (West).]
730438f-a.text:
A general view westward of the area immediately north (right) and south
of Dyckman Street, as seen from St. Nicholas Ave., at the N.W. corner of
Fairview Ave. (vantage point). IIn the left background appears the northern
tip of Fort Tryon Park and The Cloisters, a division of the Metropolitan
Museum of Art, displaying primarily, art objects of the renaissance period
of Gothic and Norman origin. At the right, across Dyckman Street, is the
southern edge of Inwood Hill Park. Note also (centre background) a portion
of the Hudson River and the Palisades cliffs of New Jersey.
April 20, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
Nea.~ 2591
730438f-a.folder: St. Nicholas Avenue - Fairview Avenue - Dyckman Street (West)., Manhattan, NY

723165f-b.title: Manhattan: St. Nicholas Avenue - Fairview Avenue
723165f-b.text:
St. Nicholas Ave. (right) north from but not including Fairview Ave.
At this point the avenue winds down a steep hill towards Nagle Ave. (where
it tertinates). Also shown is a magnificent panaromic view of the
northernmost sector of Manhattan Island, north from Dyckman Street, situated
in a valley. At the extreme right is visible a portion of Highbridge Park,
and on the extreme left, part of Fort Trgon Park. This set consists of
three views taken the same day.
April 20, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
723165f-b.folder: St. Nicholas Avenue & Fairview Avenue, Manhattan, NY
